Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with two voluted nozzles, decorated on the discus with a myrtle-wreath tied at the top, within a moulded rim. Between the nozzle-volutes are raised studs. At the rear is a pierced handle, the spine of which is decorated behind with an ivy-leaf above and a disc below. Above is a triangular handle-ornament decorated with Isis enthroned, suckling Harpocrates; on each side is a stud. The multiple base-ring is decorated with concentric mouldings. Covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1920.bis)
